intro: Lindernia stemodioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in whorls, often displaying shades of purple or pink. Lindernia stemodioides thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
